noun.description: One of the thirty-six territorial divisions of ancient Egypt.
An administrative division of modern Greece.

proper noun.description: A city in western Alaska, on the southern coast of the Seward Peninsula; population 3,576 (est. 2008). Founded in 1896 as a gold-mining camp, it became a center of the Alaskan gold rush several years later.

origin: Early 18th century: from Greek nomos division, from nemein to divide.
